alert.note: Alert for Escambia (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 15 at 3:40PM CDT until April 15 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Alabama and northwest Florida, including the following counties, in Alabama, Baldwin and Escambia. In northwest Florida, Escambia and Santa Rosa. * WHEN...Until 645 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 336 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a line of thunderstorms producing torrential rainfall over the advisory area. 1 to 2 inches of rain will fall in a short period of time, leading to flooding of roads, urban areas, and low lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pensacola, Ferry Pass, Brent, West Pensacola, Ensley, Warrington, Gonzalez, Atmore, Foley, Pace, Orange Beach, Goulding, Century, Flomaton, Lillian, Myrtle Grove, Molino, Perdido Beach, Jay and Elberta.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
